𓅂 طير ṭīr 𓅂 𓄜 𓄛 Tier 𓂧 𓂋 𓄛 𒋾 TIʳ tîr 𒉼 تیر tir তীর tīr 𓌕 til₃ <> 𓉻 dart

The famous "Tamer of two beasts" 𓀪 𓀫 𓀬 is a better trace symbol of pioneers than the swastika

Master of Animals

The earliest known depiction of the Master of Animals appears on stamp seals of the Ubaid period in Mesopotamia.[6] The motif appears on a terracotta stamp seal from Tell Telloh, ancient Girsu, at the end of the prehistoric Ubaid period of Mesopotamia, c. 4000 BC. By 3500BC the "zoo" necropolis in Nekhen displays exotic animals as proof of power over nature, beast, man and chaos.


'He' started as a she in Anatolia as "The lady with two lions", Potnia Theron, "Mistress of Animals"

30000 years early the Lion-man was an icon in much of Europe.
Afterwards the 'Venus' was the trans Eurasian Neolithic figurine!

He 𓀪 𓀫 𓀬 is very prominent from Egypt to Sumer,Jiroft@Iran all the way to the Oxus and Indus civilizations and even Europe.
